competitive_intel:
## Available Competitive Intelligence

- Competition description: `../research/description.md`
- 5 top kernel notebooks in `../research/kernels/`

data_findings.finding: Best submission score ~0.77990 (78%) achieved with tuned hard voting classifier. Decision tree-based algorithms converge on similar accuracy after tuning. Feature engineering critical: extract titles from names, create family size, bin age/fare.

Stacking achieved 0.808 (80.8%) accuracy - top 9%. Two-level stacking: First level (RF, ExtraTrees, AdaBoost, GradientBoosting, SVC), Second level XGBoost. Key features: Name_length, Has_Cabin, FamilySize, IsAlone, Title. Uncorrelated base models produce better ensemble results.

Key survival rates: Female 74.2% vs Male 18.9%. Pclass 1: 63%, Pclass 2: 47%, Pclass 3: 24%. Embarked C: 55%, Q: 39%, S: 34%. Missing values: Age (177 train, 86 test), Cabin (687 train, 327 test), Embarked (2 train), Fare (1 test).

Title survival rates: Master (young boys) 57.5%, Miss 69.8%, Mrs 79.2%, Mr only 15.7%. Rare titles like Lady, Countess, Sir, Mlle, Mme, Ms all 100% survival. Rev 0% survival. Title is highly predictive feature.
FamilySize survival: Alone (1) 30.4%, Small family (2-4) 55-72% best survival, Large family (5+) poor survival 0-33%. Non-linear relationship - medium families survive best.
